lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Brazil, whose 108 billion dlr foreign debt is the largest in the developing world, has been under pressure from official and private creditors to work out an economic adjustment program with the IMF to combat rocketing inflation and foreign payments problems.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Domestically, Funaro said economies had led to a reduction in the public sector deficit to 2.7 pct of gross domestic product in 1986, the lowest for many years and that this should fall to 1.5 pct this year.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: "We need to and will make the effort (to solve the debt problem) but we cannot make an effort that means we stop growing," he said, adding that political and not purely commercial solutions were needed to the debt crisis.
